data.title: UK Vogue February 2024 : Julia Roberts by Lachlan Bailey
data.meta_description: I've been waiting for at least 15 years for a Julia Roberts cover for Vogue (US or UK) but I've never understood why in her more than 30 year career she's...
data.text:
I've been waiting for at least 15 years for a Julia Roberts cover for Vogue (US or UK) but I've never understood why in her more than 30 year career she's only had one (Vogue US in the 90s) Does Anna Wintour not love Julia Roberts? I love the glamorous 70s style

I guess her last US Vogue covers in 94 wasn’t a best selling or something.

The cover isnt bad according to todays standards, the hair gives it a 70s / 80S YSL feel but I wish she was looking at the camera. I love the editorial, nice to see her styled in a more vintage style, Anna would have her in a garden wearing pastels or maroon.

knee-jerk reaction: she looks crazy

after seeing the other photos: she still looks crazy

it's the hair. the hair and that out of place piece of bang ruins it. full, uniform, bountiful curls would have rounded out this feature which had the elements to actually be great. the electrocuted hair flattens the whole look.

congrats on the cover, julia, but the hair... nah

I love this cover… until I look at it for too long, at which point Julia starts to look manic. Beautiful colour scheme and background though, and great to get an unexpected choice from Edward. I love an outside shot at nighttime and it’s refreshing to see one on the cover.

Happily awaiting this issue in the post, it’s the touch of glamour I need amidst the gloominess of January.

Review time!

186 pages

The Meet Cute

Star: Julia Roberts

Photographer: Lachlan Bailey

Stylist: Edward Enninful

Writer: Richard Curtis

10 pages (including article)

Great Strides

Model: Liu Wen

Photographer: Dan Martensen

Stylist: Kate Phelan

10 pages

Adventures in Motherland

Star: Sienna Miller

Photographer: Annie Leibovitz

Stylist: Tabitha Simmons

Writer: Chloe Schama

Sienna's US Vogue article + editorial

4 pages (including article)

Up & Away

Models: Sora Choi, America Gonzalez

Photographer: Scott Trindle

Stylist: Eniola Dare

12 pages

My Roman Empire

Model: Lila Moss

Photographer: Theo Liu

Stylist: Gabriella Kareefa Johnson

Writer: Jason Horowitz

Editorial shot in Rome featuring the new Gucci collection + article about Sabato De Sarno

8 pages (including article)

Reality Check

Star: AJ Odudu

Photographer: Ben Weller

Stylist: Jessica Gerardi

Writer: Kerry McDermott

Feature on TV presenter Aj Odudu

6 pages (including article)

New Horizons

Models: Angelina Kendall, Jill Kortleve, Awar Odhiang, Chu Wong

Photographer: Jack Davison

Stylist: Alex Harrington

12 pages

+

Front-of-book features on:

Cordelia De Castellane's apartment in Paris

Leslie Jamison on how to dress for her new life after divorce

Tate Modern's new director Karin Hindsbo

A look at Vogue's 'Forces for Change' party

+

Vogue Asks (back page Q&A)

Gwyneth Paltrow on the last page for 'Vogue Asks'

-

So it's quite a packed little issue! I'm actually looking forward to diving into it properly this weekend; it feels like there's plenty to look at and read. The eds are quite nice, nothing groundbreaking but enjoyable enough - nice to see Liu Wen!

So it's quite a packed little issue! I'm actually looking forward to diving into it properly this weekend; it feels like there's plenty to look at and read. The eds are quite nice, nothing groundbreaking but enjoyable enough - nice to see Liu Wen!

Thank you for review !

Maybe some new camapign for summer insider ?

Thank you for review !

Maybe some new camapign for summer insider ?

I’m not the best at keeping up with campaigns but I think this is a new one for Dolce & Gabbana? It says Spring/Summer 2024 and it’s shot by Meisel. It also lists the model names but the writing is so small and hard to read that I can only make out Nora Attal and Lulu Tenney. There’s also a model named Vivienne but I can’t read any of the others.

There are 8 pages of these ads in the issue, but here’s a couple of previews. I think the pictures are quite stunning personally, and they look beautiful in print.

Apologies if this isn’t a new campaign!

Snaps taken by me from Vogue UK February 2024 issue.

I've been waiting for at least 15 years for a Julia Roberts cover for Vogue (US or UK) but I've never understood why in her more than 30 year career she's only had one (Vogue US in the 90s) Does Anna Wintour not love Julia Roberts? I love the glamorous 70s style

Anna hates her for sure.

Thank you so much

Most of her movies are average, and among them I pick Monalisa's Smile. But even having a career like that, as Angelina Jolie, her beauty makes the things way more worthy to see. It's not a classic model beauty, she has the Hollywood beautiful appeal. It's another type, but puts her even above a fashion model. It's something I can't explain.
